security_audit.summary: Skill has legitimate data analysis functionality. Accesses API credentials for OpenAI integration and generates dynamic Python code for sandbox execution. Standard risk factors for code generation tools.

medium_findings.title: Dynamic code generation for sandbox execution
medium_findings.description: The skill generates Python code as a string that is executed in a sandbox environment. Lines 21-50 show the generate_analysis_code function which calls an LLM to produce analysis code. While this is the intended purpose, dynamically generated code execution requires proper sandboxing.

low_findings.title: API credential access from multiple sources
low_findings.description: The code reads OpenAI API credentials from config, environment variables, and settings (lines 11-17). Credentials accessed: OPENAI_API_KEY, OPENAI_BASE_URL. Ensure these are not logged or exposed in generated code.

content.value_statement: Transform raw data into insights using Python. Generate professional charts and graphs for reports and presentations.
actual_capabilities: Clean and filter data using pandas
Generate bar, line, scatter, pie, and heatmap charts
Apply professional color themes to visualizations
Save outputs as high-resolution PNG files
limitations: Requires sandbox environment for code execution
Depends on external API for code generation

use_cases.title: Analyze experimental data
use_cases.description: Process research datasets and create publication-quality figures for papers and presentations.

use_cases.title: Generate reports
use_cases.description: Create charts and graphs from business data for quarterly reports and stakeholder presentations.

use_cases.title: Build visualization features
use_cases.description: Add data charts to applications with consistent styling and automated chart generation.

prompt_templates.title: Basic chart
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a bar chart showing sales by month. Data: month,sales column pairs.

prompt_templates.title: Filter data
prompt_templates.prompt: Filter the dataset to include only values above 1000. Then create a line chart.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-variable
prompt_templates.prompt: Group data by category and create a heatmap showing the relationship between category, region, and revenue.

prompt_templates.title: Theme application
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a pie chart with the professional color theme. Save as chart_output.png.

output_examples.input: Create a bar chart showing sales by product. Data: Product A: 150, Product B: 200, Product C: 175, Product D: 125.

best_practices: Provide data in structured format with clear column descriptions
Specify exact chart type and variables for best results
State desired output format and dimensions explicitly
anti_patterns: Extremely large datasets without sampling will slow processing
Ignoring style guidelines reduces output quality
Unclear variable mappings lead to incorrect visualizations

faq.question: Does this skill run code locally or in a sandbox?
faq.answer: Code executes in a sandbox environment for security. The skill generates Python scripts that run safely isolated.

faq.question: What data size limits apply?
faq.answer: Large datasets should be sampled or aggregated first. Performance depends on sandbox resources available.

faq.question: Which Python libraries are supported?
faq.answer: pandas, numpy, matplotlib, and seaborn are available. Custom imports require sandbox configuration.

faq.question: How are API credentials handled?
faq.answer: Credentials read from environment or config only. Never included in generated code sent to sandbox.

faq.question: What chart types are available?
faq.answer: Bar, line, scatter, pie, and heatmap charts are supported. Combined charts also possible.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual Python scripting?
faq.answer: Automates chart creation from natural language. Handles styling and file output automatically.
